description: Assesses student's ability to write a satisfying story ending

levels.4: Problem is solved in a satisfying, believable way; makes sense for the story
levels.3: Problem is solved, even if solution is simple
levels.2: Ending exists but doesn't clearly solve the problem
levels.1: Story stops without solving the problem or just ends abruptly

feedback_stems.strength: You solved the problem in a great way when
feedback_stems.growth: Make sure your ending shows how the character's problem gets fixed

levels.4: Ending feels complete and satisfying; reader isn't left confused
levels.3: Ending wraps up the story adequately
levels.2: Ending is rushed or leaves reader with questions
levels.1: Doesn't feel like an ending; story just stops

feedback_stems.strength: Your ending made me feel satisfied because
feedback_stems.growth: Add a sentence that shows how the character feels now that everything is over

levels.4: Shows how the character feels or what they learned at the end
levels.3: Some indication of character's feelings at the end
levels.2: Character is present but we don't know how they feel
levels.1: Character seems forgotten in the ending

feedback_stems.strength: I loved seeing how your character felt when
feedback_stems.growth: Tell us how your character feels at the end of the story
